newsitem.title: UK: UK government allows Bulgarian refugees to stay.
newsitem.headline: UK government allows Bulgarian refugees to stay.

text.p: Two Bulgarian refugees won their two-year battle to stay in Britain after the interior ministry said on Monday it would not appeal against the decision of an immigration tribunal.
Home Secretary Michael Howard did not appeal against the decision by last Friday's deadline.
Georgi Spasov, 29, and Dimitar Dmitrov,43, claimed political asylum in April 1995 after leading a strike on a Bulgarian fishing vessel near Shetland off northern Scotland.
The lawyer representing Spasov and Dmitrov said in January that the two had real reason to fear imprisonment for their trade union activities.

Bulgaria was recently added to the government's white list' of countries where law-abiding citizens are not in danger from their government. But the immigration tribunal decided that each case should be looked at on its merits.
Both Spasov and Dmitrov received work permits over a year ago and have been working for a Shetland construction company for the past five months.
